noun.description: The theory that the human brain is composed of numerous superficial organs that are responsible for propensities, intellect, character, etc.; phrenology. Compare "organ". Now historical.
Biology. The scientific study of the anatomy and physiology of the organs of animals or plants. Now rare.
The study of the history of musical instruments.

origin: Early 19th century. From organo- + -logy. Compare French organologie.
